comments.author: alessandra@clear.net.nz
comments.content: That ricotta looks creamy and sweet. Is it really the best that you have tasted in the US? Is ricotta popular in your country?

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Ricotta *is* fairly popular, but sadly the US national brands are just terrible. Grainy and lacking the clean dairy sweetness they should have. I guess they are sort of passable for cooking, but anything where you would eat them fresh is a travesty. Calabro is great; if you can't find that or a good local variety, your best bet is to make your own from really good milk. (Which is super easy to do).
